item.title: Ivanti warns of new Connect Secure flaw used in zero-day attacks
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Ivanti is warning that a new Connect Secure remote code execution vulnerability tracked as CVE-2025-0282 was exploited in zero-day attacks to install malware on appliances. [...]

item.title: Russian ISP confirms Ukrainian hackers "destroyed" its network
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Russian internet service provider Nodex confirmed on Tuesday that its network was "destroyed" in a cyberattack claimed by Ukrainian hacktivists part of the Ukrainian Cyber Alliance [...]

item.title: SonicWall urges admins to patch exploitable SSLVPN bug immediately
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: SonicWall is emailing customers urging them to upgrade their firewall's SonicOS firmware to patch an authentication bypass vulnerability in SSL VPN and SSH management that is "susceptible to actual exploitation." [...]

item.title: Hackers exploit KerioControl firewall flaw to steal admin CSRF tokens
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Hackers are trying to exploit CVE-2024-52875, a critical CRLF injection vulnerability that leads to 1-click remote code execution (RCE) attacks in GFI KerioControl firewall product. [...]

item.title: Over 4,000 backdoors hijacked by registering expired domains
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Over 4,000 abandoned but still active web backdoors were hijacked and their communication infrastructure sinkholed after researchers registered expired domains used for commanding them. [...]

item.title: Medical billing firm Medusind discloses breach affecting 360,000 people
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Medusind, a leading billing provider for healthcare organizations, is notifying hundreds of thousands of individuals of a data breach that exposed their personal and health information more than a year ago, in December 2023. [...]

item.title: Thousands of credit cards stolen in Green Bay Packers store breach
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​American football team Green Bay Packers says cybercriminals stole the credit card data of over 8,500 customers after hacking its official Pro Shop online retail store in a September breach. [...]

item.title: How initial access brokers (IABs) sell your users’ credentials
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Specops Software
item.description: Initial Access Brokers (IABs) are specialized cybercriminals that break into corporate networks and sell stolen access to other attackers. Learn from Specops Software about how IABs operate and how businesses can protect themselves. [...]

item.title: UN aviation agency confirms recruitment database security breach
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​The United Nations' International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO) has confirmed that a threat actor has stolen approximately 42,000 records after hacking into its recruitment database. [...]

item.title: PowerSchool hack exposes student, teacher data from K-12 districts
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Education software giant PowerSchool has confirmed it suffered a cybersecurity incident that allowed a threat actor to steal the personal information of students and teachers from school districts using its PowerSchool SIS platform. [...]

item.title: Casio says data of 8,500 people exposed in October ransomware attack
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Japanese electronics manufacturer Casio says that the October 2024 ransomware incident exposed the personal data of approximately 8,500 people. [...]

item.title: New Mirai botnet targets industrial routers with zero-day exploits
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A relatively new Mirai-based botnet has been growing in sophistication and is now leveraging zero-day exploits for security flaws in industrial routers and smart home devices. [...]

item.title: US govt launches cybersecurity safety label for smart devices
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Today, the White House announced the launch of the U.S. Cyber Trust Mark, a new cybersecurity safety label for internet-connected consumer devices. [...]

item.title: BIOS flaws expose iSeq DNA sequencers to bootkit attacks
item.dc:creator: Ionut Ilascu
item.description: BIOS/UEFI vulnerabilities in the iSeq 100 DNA sequencer from U.S. biotechnology company Illumina could let attackers disable devices used for detecting illnesses and developing vaccines. [...]
